div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.p: VCS Students and Parents,

As part of the Governor’s Executive Order schools are required to create and submit a Continuity of Learning Plan to our Intermediate School District for approval. The plan is posted on our Website for those that wish to look at it in greater detail. Our plan is focused on relationships, equity, and basic learning skills. We will accomplish this using paper packets for all students. Students may access enrichment lessons and activities through the internet. However, this is for additional activities only as the packet work is the primary mode of learning. For those with limited internet access, the school internet service can be accessed from the parking lot. However, we ask that everybody remains in their vehicle and follow all social distancing requirements and recommendations.

For those students and families receiving food deliveries, we will be delivering the packets with the food on April 20th. For those that are not receiving food delivery, we will be using a no-contact, car pick-up process from 1:00-3:00 pm on Monday, April 20th. This process will include using the “bus pick up and drop-off” located behind the building. Vehicles will be asked to come from the south on Avenue B and enter the South entrance of the loop. There will then be stations set up for you to pull your vehicle up and someone will hand you the package. We will be required to stay in your vehicle at all times. There will be no contact or discussion at this time. If for some reason you do not get your packet on the 20th we will be announcing further opportunities and strategies to ensure all students get a packet. Students with IEP’s will be contacted by their service provider/teacher and will have an Individualized Continuity of Learning Plan outlining their services.

Lastly, a google form will be posted on the web-site for those that wish to request access to a Chromebook. The forms need to be completed by 5:00 pm on Thursday, April 16, 2020. These will be distributed by the same process as the packets.

p.br: As always, we hope this finds everyone safe and healthy!

h2.a: VCS Special Education General Notice Letter

p.br: We at VCS realize that there are many questions regarding individual activities and events that were scheduled for this spring. Thus, in an effort to help address those concerns we have attached a spreadsheet that lists the events and their status that we will be continuing to update as decisions are made. If your event is not listed that is because no decision has been made. To see the updated list please visit: VCS Activities Status

div.p: At this time, VCS will continue to work with families to provide food for those that are in need during the school closure. Please be advised that this process and program is subject to change per state guidelines, requirements, and recommendations. We realize that for some, Breakfast and Lunch at school are vital to many of our children. Thus, we will be delivering food to those that request it over the next 3 weeks. Anyone 18 and under qualify for the program. You do not need to be a student at VCS. Every person will receive supplies for 2 meals a day for the full week. Deliveries will take place on Monday between 12 and 3 pm. Someone must be present at the time of the delivery. However, from this point forward to ensure maximum protection for all involved and limit contact our delivery staff will not be carrying the food from the bus to homes. Someone from the home needs to be present and seen and then the food will be dropped off and the recipients will be required to pick the delivery up once the bus leaves the premises. All requests must be submitted using the link below by 8:00 am on Friday morning. * IF you have been participating and have filled out a form previously you do not have to fill out a new form each week. We are asking that you only submit new requests and/or changes using the form. If you have participated in this program your name is already on the master list.

We ask that everyone be patient as we implement this program. We know there will be rough spots but in the end, if we all work together we will be able to do what is best for our students. We are committed to serving our Children!

Vestaburg Community School's building will be closed effective Friday, March 13th at 3:00 pm through April 13th. Our facilities will be completely closed to all activities which include all athletic events. This includes practices, open gyms, fitness center use, or any team gatherings (team banquets, spring training trips, and team bonding activities). This also includes all youth sports and community meetings and/or events.

We are also in the process of evaluating activities and events throughout the month of April. Please know that we will be providing updates regarding specific events as we get more clarity and final decisions are made. Thank you for your patience as we continue to adapt to the ever changing circumstances.

div.p: Congratulations Erica Stouten - Name 2nd Team All MSAC for Cross Country.
For the 2019-2020 sport season, all VCS students (PreK - 12th Grade) are able to attend all regular season home athletic events for free. Any student PreK - 6th grade must be accompanied by an adult.

div.p: School Bus Safety

Vestaburg’s 3 year old preschool is looking for scholarship support for our three year old children. If you would like to support our preschool children, please contact Karen Gostomski at 989-560-4122 or kgostomski@vcs-k12 or call the office. All donations receive a receipt for tax purposes.
